Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: cci

Arguments.Name: flow
Arguments.Description: Commands for finding and running flows for a project

Arguments.Name: doc
Arguments.Description: Exports RST format documentation for all flows

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List available flows for the current context

Arguments.Name: --plain
Arguments.Description: Print the table using plain ascii

Arguments.Name: --org
Arguments.Description: Specify the target org. By default, runs against the current default org

Arguments.Name: --delete-org
Arguments.Description: If set, deletes the scratch org after the flow completes

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Drops into pdb, the Python debugger, on an exception

Arguments.Name: o
Arguments.Description: Pass task specific options for the task as '-o taskname__option value'. You can specify more than one option by using -o more than once

Arguments.Name: --no-prompt
Arguments.Description: Disables all prompts. Set for non-interactive mode use such as calling from scripts or CI systems

Arguments.Name: org
Arguments.Description: Commands for connecting and interacting with Salesforce orgs

Arguments.Name: browser
Arguments.Description: Opens a browser window and logs into the org using the stored OAuth credentials

Arguments.Name: --org
Arguments.Description: Alternate way to specify the target org. By default, runs against the current default org

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Navigate to the specified page after logging in

Arguments.Name: -r
Arguments.Description: Display the target URL, but don't open a browser

Arguments.Name: connect
Arguments.Description: Connects a new org's credentials using OAuth Web Flow

Arguments.Name: --org
Arguments.Description: Alternate way to specify the target org. One of ORGNAME (see above) or --org is required

Arguments.Name: --connected-app
Arguments.Description: Name of the connected_app service to use

Arguments.Name: --sandbox
Arguments.Description: If set, connects to a Salesforce sandbox org

Arguments.Name: --login-url
Arguments.Description: If set, login to this hostname

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: If set, sets the connected org as the new default org

Arguments.Name: --global-org
Arguments.Description: If set, the connected org is available to all CumulusCI projects

Arguments.Name: default
Arguments.Description: Sets an org as the default org for tasks and flows

Arguments.Name: --org
Arguments.Description: Alternate way to specify the target org. By default, runs against the current default org

Arguments.Name: --unset
Arguments.Description: Unset the org as the default org leaving no default org selected

Arguments.Name: import
Arguments.Description: Import an org from Salesforce DX

Arguments.Name: --org
Arguments.Description: Alternate way to specify the target org. One of ORGNAME (see above) or --org is required

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Display information for a connected org

Arguments.Name: --org
Arguments.Description: Alternate way to specify the target org. By default, runs against the current default org

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Print as JSON. Includes access token

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Lists all orgs in scope for the current project

Arguments.Name: --plain
Arguments.Description: Print the table using plain ascii

Arguments.Name: prune
Arguments.Description: Removes all expired scratch orgs from the current project

Arguments.Name: --include-active
Arguments.Description: Remove all scratch orgs, regardless of expiry

Arguments.Name: remove
Arguments.Description: Removes an org from the keychain

Arguments.Name: --org
Arguments.Description: Alternate way to specify the target org. One of ORGNAME (see above) or --org is required

Arguments.Name: --global-org
Arguments.Description: Set this option to force remove a global org. Default behavior is to error if you attempt to delete a global org

Arguments.Name: scratch
Arguments.Description: Connects a Salesforce DX Scratch Org to the keychain

Arguments.Name: --org
Arguments.Description: Alternate way to specify the target org. One of ORGNAME (see above) or --org is required

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: If set, sets the connected org as the new default org

Arguments.Name: --devhub
Arguments.Description: If provided, overrides the devhub used to create the scratch org

Arguments.Name: --days
Arguments.Description: If provided, overrides the scratch config default days value for how many days the scratch org should persist

Arguments.Name: --no-password
Arguments.Description: If set, don't set a password for the org

Arguments.Name: scratch_delete
Arguments.Description: Deletes a Salesforce DX Scratch Org leaving the config in the keychain for regeneration

Arguments.Name: --org
Arguments.Description: Alternate way to specify the target org. One of ORGNAME (see above) or --org is required

Arguments.Name: shell
Arguments.Description: Drop into a Python shell with a simple_salesforce connection in `sf`, as well as the `org_config` and `project_config`

Arguments.Name: --org
Arguments.Description: Alternate way to specify the target org. By default, runs against the current default org

Arguments.Name: --script
Arguments.Description: Path to a script to run

Arguments.Name: plan
Arguments.Description: Commands for getting information about MetaDeploy plans

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Displays information for a MetaDeploy plan

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List available plans for the current context

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Return the list of plans in JSON format

Arguments.Name: robot
Arguments.Description: Commands for working with Robot Framework

Arguments.Name: install_playwright
Arguments.Description: Install libraries necessary to use playwright with robot framework

Arguments.Name: uninstall_playwright
Arguments.Description: Uninstalls the robotframework-browser package and node modules

Arguments.Name: service
Arguments.Description: Commands for connecting services to the keychain

Arguments.Name: connect
Arguments.Description: Connect an external service to CumulusCI

Arguments.Name: connected_app
Arguments.Description: Connect a Connected App service to CumulusCI

Arguments.Name: --login_url
Arguments.Description: Default Salesforce Login URL to be used with this Connected App

Arguments.Name: --callback_url
Arguments.Description: Callback URL configured on the Connected App

Arguments.Name: --client_id
Arguments.Description: Client ID/Consumer Key from the Connected App

Arguments.Name: --client_secret
Arguments.Description: Client Secret/Consumer Secret from the Connected App

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: Set this service as the global default

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Help for cci service connect connected_app

Arguments.Name: devhub
Arguments.Description: Connect a DevHub service to CumulusCI

Arguments.Name: --username
Arguments.Description: Username or alias of the SFDX org to use as a Dev Hub

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: Set this service as the global default

Arguments.Name: github
Arguments.Description: Connect a GitHub service to CumulusCI

Arguments.Name: --username
Arguments.Description: The Github username to use for tasks

Arguments.Name: --email
Arguments.Description: The email address to used by Github tasks when an operation requires an email address

Arguments.Name: --token
Arguments.Description: Personal Access Token for GitHub. Leave blank to log in via browser

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: Set this service as the global default

Arguments.Name: github_enterprise
Arguments.Description: Connect a GitHub Enterprise service to CumulusCI

Arguments.Name: --username
Arguments.Description: The GitHub Enterprise username to use for tasks

Arguments.Name: --email
Arguments.Description: The email address to used by GitHub tasks when an operation requires an email address

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: Set this service as the global default

Arguments.Name: marketing_cloud
Arguments.Description: Connect a Marketing Cloud service to CumulusCI

Arguments.Name: --oauth2_client
Arguments.Description: The name of the oauth2_client service with which to establish a connection to Marketing Cloud

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: Set this service as the global default

Arguments.Name: metaci
Arguments.Description: Connect a MetaCI service to CumulusCI

Arguments.Name: --url
Arguments.Description: The main url to the MetaCI site

Arguments.Name: --token
Arguments.Description: Your API token to the MetaCI site (get from SITE_URL/api/token)

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: Set this service as the global default

Arguments.Name: metadeploy
Arguments.Description: Connect a MetaDeploy service to CumulusCI

Arguments.Name: --url
Arguments.Description: The main url for your MetaDeploy instance

Arguments.Name: --token
Arguments.Description: Your API token to the MetaDeploy site (get from SITE_URL/admin/authtoken/token)

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: Set this service as the global default

Arguments.Name: oauth2_client
Arguments.Description: Connect an OAuth2 Client service to CumulusCI

Arguments.Name: --auth_uri
Arguments.Description: The URI for where users are directed to login

Arguments.Name: --token_uri
Arguments.Description: The URI for where we request an access token

Arguments.Name: --callback_url
Arguments.Description: The URL that the auth server will callback to after authentication of the user

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: Set this service as the global default

Arguments.Name: default
Arguments.Description: Set the default service for a given service type

Arguments.Name: --project
Arguments.Description: Sets the service as the default for the current project

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Show the details of a connected service

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List services available for configuration and use

Arguments.Name: --plain
Arguments.Description: Print the table using plain ascii

Arguments.Name: update
Arguments.Description: Allow users to update attribute values of a particular service

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Provide values to update the service with directly. Using `--attribute foo var` will set the 'foo' attribute to a value of 'bar' on the specified service

Arguments.Name: --script
Arguments.Description: Path to a script to run

Arguments.Name: task
Arguments.Description: Commands for finding and running tasks for a project

Arguments.Name: doc
Arguments.Description: Exports RST format documentation for all tasks

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List available tasks for the current context

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: Print the current version of CumulusCI

Arguments.Name: error
Arguments.Description: Get or share information about an error

Arguments.Name: gist
Arguments.Description: Creates a GitHub gist from the latest logfile

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Outputs the most recent traceback (if one exists in the most recent logfile)

Arguments.Name: project
Arguments.Description: Commands for interacting with project repository configurations

Arguments.Name: dependencies
Arguments.Description: Displays the current dependencies for the project. If the dependencies section has references to other github repositories, the repositories are inspected and a static list of dependencies is created

Arguments.Name: --resolution-strategy
Arguments.Description: The resolution strategy to use. Defaults to production

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Display information about the current project's configuration

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Initialize a new project for use with the cumulusci toolbelt
